caption:
This photograph captures a field of young plants, each supported by thin vertical stakes, a common sight in agricultural settings. The plants appear to be small and bushy, possibly young tomato plants or another vegetable crop, with the stakes used for support as they grow.

In the background, several large billboards are visible, contributing a contrast between the natural agricultural foreground and the commercial background. The billboards advertise a variety of subjects, including locations like Lake Tahoe and a California tennis club, implying the setting may be in or near California. One billboard prominently reads "THE SHORES LAKE FRONT APARTMENTS," offering rentals with daily, weekly, and monthly rates, along with a provided phone number.

The horizon shows a clear sky with broad daylight illuminating the scene. Additionally, power lines can be seen extending across the field at the top of the frame, further suggesting the juxtaposition of rural and urban elements. The photography technique used here focuses on the farthest objects, the billboards, slightly blurring the foreground stakes, which adds depth to the image and draws the viewerâ€™s eye toward the signs.
title: Development signs border one of a few remaining farm fields near the ocean in fast growing orange county.  Some 84 percent of the state's residents live within 30 miles of the coast and it has resulted in increasing land use pressures.  Since november, 1972 regulatory commissions have been charged with determining development within 1,000 yards of the coast.  The commissions must submit a report to the legislature by january, 1976, recommending a plan for future coastal development
